item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Uh, I know you said you need to be taken out of a contract…
But I use Walmart’s Family Talk. I pay about $30/mo (Like 29 and some change), which gives me:
Unlimited Talk
Unlimited Text
1GB 4G LTE data
Unlimited 3G data.

The more expensive plan gives the same features, but 2GB of 4G LTE data.

It works rather well for me in terms of connection… I haven’t had any problems with my signal.

When I was with AT&T I’d lose signal at my house and at Target (Where I worked at the time), but I’d have perfect signal at the AT&T store (Which was in the same shopping center as Target, and about 4 blocks from my house). And they also were costly af.

item.title: [Cell Phone] Cheaper Plan
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

[quote=“DeathsChaos9, post:1, topic:552809”]Right now I am with Verizon and still under contract (so I need a company that will buy me out of my contract)
Plan Features:

  • Unlimited Talk
  • Unlimited Txt
  • 2Gb data

Current bill: $70/mo

Does anyone know a cheaper alternative without sacrificing features?[/quote]
In a major city or more rural? Your plan is going to be very hard to beat without jumping to a carrier like Straight Talk that runs on someone else’s network. T-Mobile and Sprint are the only ones to buy you out of a contract, but both don’t have nearly the same coverage unless its a major city.

T-Mobile is $60/mo for the same plan as yours, but they don’t do subsidized phones. You’ll either have to buy it at full price, or do it on a 24-month installment plan which is around $25-35/mo for top tier phones. They don’t charge you for data overages, so you will get 2gb at 4G LTE speeds, and anything after that is throttled to 2g speeds.

Should also note how the contract buyout works. You will still have to front the early termination fee, and bring your new carrier a copy of the final bill. They will process it and send you a prepaid Amex or Visa within a few weeks.
